%%spark
display(spark.range(10))
case class MapEntry(key: String, value: Int)
val largeSeries = for (x <- 1 to 5000) yield MapEntry("k_%04d".format(x), x)
val largeDataFrame = sc.parallelize(largeSeries).toDF()
largeDataFrame.registerTempTable("largeTable")
display(spark.sqlContext.sql("select * from largeTable"))

%%pyspark
print("this is Python")
import platform
print(platform.platform())

val blob_account_name = "datasetarcadia"
val blob_container_name = "wideworldimporters"
val blob_relative_path = "dimension_Customer/"
val blob_sas_token = s"?sv=2018-03-28&ss=bfqt&srt=sco&sp=rwdlacup&se=2019-07-13T07:32:42Z&st=2019-07-09T23:32:42Z&spr=https&sig=iVpGfb5yLi3pskn3%2Bl%2B1S3SQODcndTHyAhR5W5c7OYM%3D"
val wasbs_path = s"wasbs://${blob_container_name}@${blob_account_name}.blob.core.windows.net/${blob_relative_path}"
spark.conf.set("fs.azure.account.key.datasetarcadia.blob.core.windows.net" , "k2wTXor/8YikczxgvK2RqcHq3iat7jE2WMxaTXHOfgpluoKlVOjwUjpDKE3xP+Blymx6Ba/VSPSVw33SZqKTyw==")

// Cell 2
import org.apache.spark.sql._
import org.apache.spark.sql.types._
val customSchema = (new StructType).
    add("Customer_Keyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyy",IntegerType,true).
    add("WWI_Customer_ID",IntegerType,true).
    add("Customer",StringType,true).
    add("Bill_To_Customer",StringType,true).
    add("Category",StringType,true).
    add("Buying_Group",StringType,true).
    add("Primary_Contact",StringType,true).
    add("Postal_Code",IntegerType,true).
    add("Valid_From",DateType,true).
    add("Valid_To",DateType,true).
    add("Lineage_Key",IntegerType,true)

import pandas as pd
df = pd.read_csv(
  "https://gist.githubusercontent.com/rgbkrk/a7984a8788a73e2afb8fd4b89c8ec6de/raw/db8d1db9f878ed448c3cac3eb3c9c0dc5e80891e/2015.csv"
)
display(df)

// Join the two tables based on two columns whose names are different (Customer Key)
val result = facttx.as('a).
    join(dimcustomer.as('b),$"a.Customer Key" === $"b.Customer_Key",joinType="left").
    groupBy("Customer").sum().
    select("Customer","sum(sum(Total Excluding Tax))").
    toDF("Customer","Sales")
result.show()

// Load the data into a new SQL Compute table and define the column data type
val driverClass = "com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerDriver"
connectionProperties.setProperty("Driver", driverClass)
result.write.option("createTableColumnTypes", "Customer varchar(80), Sales decimal(18,2)").jdbc(jdbcUrl,"dbo.sales_buyinggroup", connectionProperties)
